name: Kunefe (Kunāfah)
description: Crunchy layers of shredded and buttered kataifi dough, filled with cheese cream flavored with cardamom, and drenched in a sugar syrup infused with lemon juice and orange blossom water. Topped with pistachios and served warm.

name: Güllaç (Rosy Dish)
description: A unique Turkish dessert that is the most popular during Ramadan. Layers of thin, cornstarch pastry soaked in rosewater-infused milk and stuffed with walnuts.

name: Pistachio Baklava
description: Traditional pastry dessert of Turkey. Layered pastry dessert made of filo pastry, filled with chopped pistachio, and sweetened with special syrup. Gluten-free option available.

name: Walnut Baklava
description: Layered pastry dessert made of filo pastry, filled with chopped walnuts, and sweetened with special syrup. Gluten-free option available.

name: Lavas Puff Bread
description: The famous Turkish puffed flatbread, also called 'lavas', to wrap kebabs as durum. Made from a simple dough, sprinkled with sprinkled with nigella seeds and cooked in a traditional oven so it crisps and puffs-up.

name: Sigara Böreği (Cripsy Cheese Rolls)
description: Fried crispy rolls of thin dough stuffed with cheese and parsley.

name: Su Böreği (Water Borek with Cheese)
description: Everyone's favorite borek in Turkey! Baked dough sheets filled with cheese, parsley, and minced meat.

name: Lokma
description: Sugar-packed dessert made with a mixture of flour, sugar, yeast, and salt, which is deep-fried and then bathed in syrup or honey. 5 pieces per portion.

name: Ramadan Pide
description: Soft bread traditionally baked in Turkey for the iftar and sahur meals during the month of Ramadan.Gluten-free option available.

name: Apple Cookies
description: Melt-in-the-mouth cookies made with crispy cookie dough filled with apple, cinnamon, walnuts.

name: Katmer
description: Usually served for breakfast. Crisp phyllo dough dessert filled with pistachios and cream.

name: 'Flour' Cookies
description: Traditional un kurabiyesi. Delicious melt-in-the-mouth cookie covered with powdered sugar and filled with pistachios.

name: Acma
description: Traditional Turkish style soft sweet bagels usually eaten during breakfast. Made with twisted layers of dough and butter that melts in your mouth. Sprinkled with sesame seeds.

name: Cornbread
description: Traditional bread of Black Sea Region of Turkey made with cornmeal.

name: Simit
description: Circular bread encrusted with sesame seeds. Essential for Turkish breakfast!
